paper_metadata.title: Enabling graduation for whom? Identifying and explaining heterogeneity in livelihood trajectories post-cash transfer exposure

program_information.program_name_citation: We use a data set from a graduation programme in Rwanda
program_information.country_citation: We use a data set from a graduation programme in Rwanda
program_information.target_population_citation: Many social protection programmes (frequently labelled as graduation programmes) that rely on a combination of cash transfers, savings and training for the protection and promotion of poor people's lives and livelihoods

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: Many social protection programmes (frequently labelled as graduation programmes) that rely on a combination of cash transfers, savings and training

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Results for value of assets and TLUs are similar to those found for the food security and basic needs indicator
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: Using novel panel survey data from a NGO-implemented graduation model programme in Rwanda
